Pours a hazy orange with a medium creamy white head that laced.  Aroma of mixed citrus, light banana, clove and a nice rounded maltiness.  Flavor of lemon, orange, light banana, clove and a touch of toasted malt.
banana, citrus, golden, orange, cloudy, medium sweetness, medium body, sticky,

12 oz bottle.  Cloudy orange brown with active carb and a foamy white head.  Nose is banana, clove, toffee and citrus zest.  Chewy, wheaty medium body with a zippy tang.  Taste is banana and bubblegum, orange zest and cardamon.  Quite sweet finishing with burnt sugar.

12oz bottle Beer Camp 6/11/11 (Binnys Downers Grove Singles Rack)-48° in Weizen Glass-Pours a murky yellowish orange with a nice two finger head. Aroma of wheat, banana, coriander, and spices. Taste of the same with a lot of banana and coriander. This medium bodied brew comes across more like a Hefe but is still very well balanced and quite tasty.
Solid version, tastes a bit more like a hefe to me, but still very solid, citrus aroma, light and fluffy, great summer brew.  A little watered down but not very noticeable.  Nice yeast flavors.

Location: 12 oz bottle at jcos place, 6/11/11,  as the Best of Beer Camp Weizenbock, Camp # 37


Aroma: The nose is made up of wheat, lemon, sugar, banana, spice, and other fruity notes

Appearance: It pours into the glass a bright golden-orange color with a small white head

Flavor: The taste is rather sweet lots banana and citrus, spice/wheat there, but more subtle

Palate: It has a fairly clean feel, it is pretty full bodied, and it leaves a sugary stickiness on the mouth

Overall Impression: 
This one is a fairly solid Weizenbock.  It leans toward the sweet side for sure, and is a little too sugary for my tastes, but it isnt bad.  I still enjoyed drinking this one, and found it to be well made.  It is certainly not light on flavor or substance, which is a positive for sure.  I enjoyed drinking this one, but that sugary stickiness in the taste and mouthfeel holds it back for me just a little bit.

12 oz bottle from beer Camp Pack BevMo Salinas. Nose is light banana, caramel, cloves, and bready yeast. Murky yellow orange with a medium cream colored head. Flavor is bananas, light sweetness, and a bit of caramel rolls. pretty good weizenbock! Wish I could buy six packs rather than the sampler.

Beer Camp 12pack bottle .. . i am not burning the duster! .. . Pours a really murky light tan brown, fantastic head/lacing .. . mmm, banana, light cloves, bunny, yeast chocalte, and german bread .. . wow! i am really impressed with this- smoothness and real authenticity for the style .. . me likie, stormy is happy .. . . What the hell is a jiggawatt?!

~Strong banana phenols with light clove and melanoidins.
~Pours a very cloudy orange gold color with small white head.
~Banana flavor with some pineapple and bready malts.
~Medium full body, slightly creamy, med CO2, sweet finish.
~Enjoyable Weizen bock. I wish the malts had a bit more dominance over the yeast.
Pours a hazy orange hints of banana and clove on the nose.had a light carbonation and more sweetness on the aftertaste.

12oz bottle, Beer Camp 12-pack. Pours a pulpy, sunny-orange color; modest, fine-bubbled off-white head with solid retention. Nice levels of clove, caramelized banana, and quiet citrus in the aroma; clear, focused, yeasty nose thats zesty and alive without showing signs of unchecked fermentation temps; really quite nice, balanced between the banana and clove elements. Medium body; medium-high CO2; no overt alcohol (a touch of warmth, if that). Lots of yeasty goodness at the forefront of things: cloves, crème brûlée, banana custard... A mouthful of yeasty sunshine, with precise acidity, an engaging mineral and citrus bitterness, and a real nice toasty wheatiness at the core of things. Solid, delicious beer. Medium-length finish: cloves, husky wheat, with a long toasty ending.

12 oz bottle from Bier Stein. Hazy golden pour with a half inch of white foam. Smells of banana, wheat, a little clove and the flavor adds some light citrus at the finish. This is far more weizen than bock, but I still liked the beer. Nice and quaffable.
12 ounce from Beer Camp 12 pack bought at Liquor Barn Chevy Chase. Big white head. Little sour in the nose. Caramel and wheat in the taste. Some apple. This is pretty good.

Bottle.  Appearance is a hazy golden orange/brown with a pillowy white head and decent lacing.  Smells like of sweet honey and cloves with the yeasty and banana notes.   The taste is semisweet with bananas and clove with some known hoppy components.  Very nice and amply complex beers.  I am loving this Beer Camp Mix pack thus far.
delicious!!  lots of rich flavors that explode. bready, taste of bubble gum, banana and wheat. low hops but the beer is smooth and thick.

Banana and funk nose, with a complimentary lemon tartness. Cloudy burnt orange, thick head, good lacing. Medium body, pleasantly soft carbonation. Apricot and banana flavor, noticeable lack of cloves for the style, but that doesnt bother me. Babyfood in the finish with lemon zest and lemongrass, nicely hopped. Alcohol is noticeable, but acceptable. Fruity and delicious. Very good.

"Beer Camp"... Bottle picked up at SL.. Monster rocky head that took a while to settle... Great nose of some banana, wheat and spice cloves. Taste is lots of banana, spices, hay, vanilla... Very tasty... Little on the sweet side but enjoyable. Medium body, very easy to drink. Overall. Another winner by SN.

Pours a wacky orange color with a white head. Smells of coriander, orange, and other spices. Taste is similar to aroma. I usually dont like this style of beer but this one is tasty! Very refreshing after a long day of work.

Bottle from EZ. Pours a Cloudy orange color with a bubbly white head. Aroma is of bubblegum, banana, and some light spice. Taste is much the same as the aroma, bubblegum, banana, spice and some light fruity notes.

Bottled sample via and shared with oakbluff. Hazy gold in colour with strong carbonation. Aromas are of bubblegum, mild banana and even fainter vanilla. Bubblegum forward in the mouth as well, along with gummy wheat malt, vanilla, and a bit of clove. Medium to heavy bodied, but thick rather than sweet. A step up in robustness from a regular hefeweiss. Well executed, but nothing special.

The aroma is cloves, lemon, dark raisiny fruits with the touch of funky yeast. Dry champagne.

The appearance is uber-cloudy golden yellow. Tons of carbonation. Huge fluffy head. Thick swatch of lace. Textbook.

The flavor is cloves, minor hint of banana. Dry white wine. Dates and stone fruits. Funky spices that add a zing to it. Orange peel and lemon.

Palate is smooth, buttery with a prickly finish. Very smooth and easy-drinkin. Clovey, dry and well-balanced. A really accessible weizenbock.
Bottle.Pours a nice yellow with an aroma of faint banana and bubblegum.  Flavor is banana and weak clove.  Average mouthfeel.  Meh, there are better.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Bottle from a mix pack.  Pours a milky yellow, has a nice white head with great lacing.  Nose is huuuuuuuuge banana, a nice wheaty twang, clove is relatively restrained.  A bit of alcohol is apparent, but not overwhelming.  Flavor is banana, nice pils malt, a bit of a twang, some very nice clove & plum.  Alcohol is present in the flavor too, but again, its pretty restrained.  Body is great on this one - lusciously creamy.

Pours an opaque orange...lighter than many weizenbocks Ive had...with a creamy lt. Tan head.  Aroma is yeasty with notable spice and citrus.  Flavor follows suit with some wheaty notes at the end but tastes somewhat like a saison.  Mouthfeel is lively and creamy with a dry spiced finish.   Very tasty but I prefer more clovey notes in a weizenbock.
Plenty good with bananas and orange aroma, cloudy body (which is a must in this style, in my opinion) and a gentle balance between body and carbonation.  Excellent, easy drinking beer.
Pours a golden hazy yellow with a large head. Smells of oranges and spice. Taste is sweet at the start with orange overtones and spice. Quickly moves to lemony hops finishing with a clean dry ending.

Pours completely hazed golden orange with a large frothy white head. Aroma is strong and has a lot of sweet grain and fruit, along with some dank yeast funk. Taste is also strong, some bitterness, lots of thick sweet malt. Pretty good, doughy, yeasty, fruity. Medium body, medium high carbonation.

12oz Bottle  99 Bottles  Federal Way, WA 
Golden in color, cloudy with a thin white head.  Nice wheat aromas with banana and mixed fruit.  Flavors are a wonderful mixture of malts fruits and light hops.  Very tasty brew indeed.

12 oz bottle from Bevmo. This is a beer camp bottle from a mix pack. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a small white head that soon fades to a fine ring. The aroma is strong with bubble-gum, banana and a mixed fruit cocktail. The flavor is more of the same, big bubble-gum taste with mixed fruits set in a lightly hoppy wheat base. The palate is full and chewy with lively carbonation. The finish is long  and dry. Overall: A first rate weizenbock.

Nearly opaque orange-amber with a moderate off-white head. Aroma of spice, oranges, lemon pie, caramel, wheat, banana and bubblegum. The taste is sweet and fruity, and very yeasty. It has a full body and a bit of a thick, oily texture. Complex, and quite good. The sweetness isnt overbearing like it is in some other weizenbocks.

Bottle in a flare pils. Very hazy glowing light orange pour with a large white head. Good retention and lace. Bomb aroma of orange, coriander, clove, and cream. Very sweet attack, followed by a creamsickle sweet middle. Medium body, fluffy creamy texture which then oozes to a fruity vanilla sweet finish.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange-gold with a huge, high, meringue-like head. Some banana and clove on the nose, but theres also a dry acidity like a white wine. Roasty on the front of the mouth, but with a fleeting sweetness at the close -- almost maple. Finishes a little murky, with light carbonation and more sweetness on the aftertaste. I like this.
Cloudy, orange ear wax color. Thicker cream colored head. The smell is heavy fruits, banana, esters, some wheat in there as well. The taste is wheat, fruits, banana, and ok.

Bottle. Pours hazy gold with a massive white head which leaves excellent retention/lace. Aroma is banana, clove, bready, fruity. Flavor is rich, sweet banana pudding, yeasty, bready, light citrus. Its a bit on the sweet side but definitely an excellent weizenbock/unfiltered hefeweizen.

Weisenbock

Sampled on 5/21/2011. This weizenbock pour a hazy orange gold color from a 12oz bottle.  Medium sized beige foamy head, with nice lacing and good retention. The aroma is fruity, bready and sweet. A medium bodied weizenbock. The malts are fruity, bready and sweet. The hops are earthy. Nice balance. Good carbonation. Smooth taste. Just a hint of banana. Very nice beer. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

This is  a really nicely done example of this style by an American brewer. Its a pretty hazy orange w/ a long lasting head of mixed bubbles. The creamy, juicy texture is the nicest thing about this beer, pretty much spot on,  but Im not going to complain about the gently spicy aroma or the big banana flavor either. I dont think this is a perfect beer by any means, one specific weak point being a lack of vibrant fruitiness in the nose, but it does show one element that I feel separates the great brewers from the ones that are merely good: special attention to texture. There is something about the way this beer handles itself going down that just makes you want to drink more.

Had this in its guise as a Beer Camp number: a glowing orange haze in a glass with some fat, creamy head. A HUGE orange, banana, tangerine and clove nose with some pulpy, floury yeast notes in there too. smooth and drinkable to flavours are a match to the bouquet and a muffled explosion on the palate.

A  lot going on with this brew, and its all good. Nice  hazed orange pour with  a yeasty, lemon, honey , sugar aroma that is matched in taste.

A good blend of alcohol. Really good.

The aroma is a touch sour with hints of wheat, yeast, fruit (banana), spice, and caramel malt. The appearance is deep gold-orange with a thick haze of yeast. The taste is like the aroma but not entirely good. The palate is smooth. Overall I like the style but am a bit disappointed with this one.

Beer Camp Bottle.  Pours a hazy golden orange with a small frothy white head.  Never really had a super hoppy weizenbock before, comes off kinda peppery, sweet overripe banana, candied wheat, seltzer water sprtiziness, bit of toasted sugar, sweet but drinkable and only lightly sticky.  Aroma is great, full bodied candied wheat beer with balanced banana, very nice.  Great body, has all that weizenbock delicious flavor but fantastic spritzy carbonation and body.  Some lingering bitterness that is slightly medicinal with the sugar.  Some odd phenols, alcohol, and interesting maltiness, very unique.

Cloudy banana-shake color with sea foam head. Airy sea salt and foam nose with full breaths of esters and phenols and breadiness, banana, and a touch of uric. A complex and exuberant yeast. Easy banana bread and yeast flavor. Zesty and lively.

My Favorite Style.
12oz bottle :: Camp #37.  Best of Beer Camp 12pk.  Vintage 2011. Copper Cap.  Pours with a solid cloudiness, 100% Unfiltered, golden haze.  The thickest head of white cream you may ever come across.  Aroma of banana, yeast, bubblegum, clove, wheat malt, floral hops, and a bit of alcohol.    Very creamy texture.  Flavor of spicy yeast, white pepper, banana, wheat malt, citrus and herbs.  Finishes with a lager yeast character of the slightest hint of basement.  This beer is simply a  unfiltered Hefeweizen-Bock.   Yummy to say the least.  Well done, heavy bodied.
weizenbock says German,but my taste buds say belgian.A nice yeastiness with just the right amount of sweetness.Another great offering from Sierra Nevada!

Bottle pours cloudy yellow orange with thick foamy white head.  Aroma bananas and cloves, tastes matches with wheat, yeast and spices.  Medium palate with moderate carbonation.  Clean brief finish with slight hops. Alcohol not evident.  Nice.
murky hay-gold, thin white ring. Bubblegum and honey in the nose, bit f light yeast. Flavor sweeter, more honey, dusty yeast with light cardboard. Thick, low carb body.

From the beer camp mix twelve.  Aroma is sweet and sugary - banana, clove and honey.  Taste is bubblegum, lemon and spices.  Lots of carbonation - medium bodied.  Not my favorite style - but this seems a good one.
Orangish pour.  Very sweet and spicy aroma.  Oranges, toffee.  Flavor is sweet, malty, yeast, stone fruit.

Pours orange with a tall white head. The aroma is like sweet banana cake with some clove and spices. The flavor is very yeasty and sweet with banana and spices. The body is very big and has a smooth creaminess on the palate. The finish is very spiced. Alcohol is slightly noticeable.
Bottle.  Was surprised by how complete this beer is.  Refreshing with lots of flavor and a good body.  Recommend as a good choice.

Poured from bottle.  Lemon cake aroma.  Beautiful solid gold with lacing white head.  Flavors of angel food cake, lemon meringue, citrus, banana, a hint of pepper and alcohol.  Burnt caramel aftertaste.  Finished well. Great stuff.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Pours hazy orange with a bit of off white head. Aroma of banana, clove, yeast, a bit of caramel, malt, yeast. Flavorful, fruity, complex. A fantastic beer.

I love everything about this beer - cloudy orange color with a creamy white head that reduces and becomes more foamy after the pour.  Aroma of bananas, and subtle hints of brown sugar and warm bread.  Taste has bananas, sweet malt, and a tiny hint of lactic acid which is all i want personally.  Finish is extremely smooth with vanilla type character.  This beer is outstanding!
12 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy deep golden honey with a medium sized frosty off white head.  Aroma of wheat, mild fruit, cloves and banana.  Taste of mild fruit, banana, cloves and wheat.  Nice beer.

bottle...big caramel sweetness in the nose with toasted grain, banana, grass, and a touch of bubblegum...flavor is more sweet and less balanced than its nose...big bubblegum and banana sweetness overpowers the rest of what i captured in the aroma...that being said, i find this to be quite tasty and well-done

On draft at Good Beer, where it was called Best of Beer Camp Weizenbock.  Sweet and fruity, with a nice light fizz on the palate.  Some prune and brett, and a touch of bitter hops in the finish.  Beautifully balanced and fresh.  I am a big fan of good weizenbocks, and this definitely was one.

Bottle...  Poured opaque, hazy orange with a slightly, off-white head.  Nose was yeasty, phenolic, and banana.  Slightly drying, wheat tones that lent to creaminess and wheat malt tones.  Slightly citrus with bananas, cloves, phenols.  Mildly floral with hops and pretty sweet towards the finish.

Bottle:  The aroma consists of moderate banana, bubblegum, and clove.  It pours a cloudy dull orangish-yellow with a one finger head that fades to a thin film outlined by a slightly thicker ring.  The flavor starts with moderate banana and bubblegum.  The finish has some stronger bubblegum notes, wheaty tanginess, and light clove.  Medium bodied with moderate carbonation and a soft mouthfeel.

Very strong aroma of bananas while the appearance is dark gold with heavy amber cloudyness.  The flavor is of yeast, grain, and malty.  This is about as close to an American weizen of any kind that can be said to be as great as the German greats of the various weizen styles.

Pours a couldy dirty gold, bordering on orange with a large white head that fades to a thick ring of foam.  Aroma has plenty of cloves and juicy fruit character, but thats balanced with some lemon, grass, abundant pepper, hay, and bread dough.  Flavor starts with bread dough and hay with clove, pepper, spice, light juicy fruit character, mushrooms and smoke (or something acting like it).  Finishes with the bread flavors drying out, the juicy fruit fading to a faint aftertaste and the hops and yeast leaving a mix of funk and mild peppery bitterness on the throat.  Medium bodied, creamy and full, this is like drinking silk.  As well made as the Kellerweiss (thank God!), I like this beer even though I dont like weizenbocks to be pale.
Pours a banana color, aroma immediate of spices, bananas, cloves and yeast.  Lacing evident, flavour was full bodied.  Rather tasty and drinkable.  SN does it again, impressive.
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: 12oz bottle from Beer Camp 12pk sampler bought at Binnys (Lakeview). Dark yellow, good head. That clove and banana comes through in the nose. A good bit of spice in the flavor with the finish lingering in the spices while hiding the alcohol well. Overall another great beer from Sierra Nevada.

(12oz bottle from Beer Camp mixer pack).  Pours a cloudy yellow with a white pillow-top head.  Aroma has banana, clove, wheat and a bit of citrus.  Taste is sweet with light bittering hops on the end.  Medium bodied with a thick texture.  Pleasantly bitter finish (though slight).  This is a very drinkable beer and I must say that I like it quite a bit.

Bottle from Beer Camp 12 pack - turbid gold pour with a lively, compact head - fairly swee aroma, with a lot of overripe banana, honeydew melon, earthy wheat malt, peppery phenols and robust yeastiness - full but soft carbonation - medium bodied - sweet banana and melon, a bit of raw cane sugar - gets a bit tangy and wheaty through the middle and finish - ends with lingering sweetness, but with pronounced spiciness from the yeast, as well as a chewy/doughy quality - a little sweet, but this is a weizenbock - its good.

Bottle. Poured an hazy orange color with an large frothy off-white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Medium to heavy citrus, banana and clove aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy balanced bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Solid drinkable beer.

12oz bottle - #37 Best of Beer Camp.
Cloudy orange pour with a creamy white head.  Nose of wheat, banana, and clove - very creamy and enjoyable.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2011 Bottle @ home. Pours a very cloudy yellow orange appearance with a huge fluffy, orange-cream colored head. Quite citrusy, orange, lemon, banana, lots of yeast, and pretty strong wheat malty nose. Big yeasty, orange, lemon, banana, bread, and quite wheat malty. Very smooth and pretty flavorful.

Bottle poured a cloudy gold with a lasting creamy ivory head. Aromas of wheat, yeast, banana, light citrus and a hint of clove. Palate was mediuim bodied and crisp with a smooth finish. Flavors of wheat, yeast, banana, light citrus and a hint of clove with a smooth lingering banana finish.

5/19/11. 12oz bottle. Cloudy orange pour with a frothy off-white head that sticks. Huge banana aroma with some sweet cream and spicy yeast. Sweet creamy banana flavor with a subtler hint of spice in there. Nice!
nice brew, nice full and thick mouthfeel, best part of the brew. well done sn.

Beer Camp 12oz bottled April 5, 2011.
Pours very cloudy pale orange with a large off white foamy head that maintains a good cap and leaves plenty of lacing.

Aroma is spicy, mostly clove with a good deal of banana and bubblegum, a hint of cinnamon, some bread and yeast.  Clove and banana dominate.  Good to very good strength.

Flavor is banana, lemon, clove and other spices, bubblegum, a bit of citrus, a pretty strong caramel and toffee backbone lends some sweetness, low bitterness, low alcohol.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied, medium to high carbonation.

You know...for someone who isnt big into wheat beers, this was pretty darned good.  I can see why fans of the style are really diggin this brew.  Well crafted.

Pours turbid dark straw with 3-finger white head.  Nose is big hops, yeasty spicy floral malt, fruit.  Tastes malty, creamy, a bit lactic, with notes of floral spice, hops, and fruit.  Pretty rich, complex palate.
Great orange/ caramel color. Sweet banana and big bock malt. Really enjoyable, maybe my favorite from the 12 pack.

Another home run for this pack, a really nice beer for the style with authentic yeast ester tastes of banana and slight clove accented with good amounts of toffee sweetness to balance.  A really great beer.

12oz bottle as part of 2011 "Best of Beer Camp" variety pack. Nice, hazy yellow-orange color, and minimal head with a slow, careful pour. This is my first ever weizenbock, and after enjoying my first few hefeweizens, Im looking forward to this. Delicious sweet taste, banana/spice aroma Id expect from a hefeweizen but balanced with malt aromas. Thicker carbonation than I like, but very interesting and drinkable.

Opaque hazy golden amber with a huge white head that cascades a bit then has crazy retention.. Awesome Lacing... Loads of trad hefe aroma, slight spice, slight banana, lots of malts, some lemon, then some grassy hops... Somewhat lively, couldve been my pour that took some of that away... a little sweet in the finish, banana clove finish.. Decent flavor, could pop a bit more, spicy banana subtle, a little dry, light bread and grassy hop notes.. I like it, dont love...

A: The beer pours a hazed golden orange color with a finger or two of off-white head.

S: Big time banana to the nose.  A moderate spice character, mostly clove, with plenty of sweet bread and caramel malts.  Nice wheat character and a hint of bubblegum.

T: Great banana flavor along with some hints of orange.  Clove gives a nice spiciness to the beer and there is plenty of sweet bread, toffee, and wheat.  Really a nice flavor.

M: Medium in body and carbonation.

O: Easily the best beer in the Beer Camp pack and a pretty solid beer all around.
I think this was the best Weizen Bock i have had. It pours a cloudy yellow with good head and lacing on each sip. The taste is grassy and earthy with a bite at the backend, kind od like a saison.

From Beer Camp 12 pack, last beer to try.. Poured hazy golden with medium. white head.  Sweet candy like nose with hints of wheat .Fruity taste, bananas, kiwis, a bit spicy.  Nice finish, overall a good beer.

Bottle - 12 oz from the Sierra Nevada Beer Camp Variety Pack. Muddy gold with a tall, fluffy gold head. Aroma is sweet malt, candied fruit, banana, wheat, grains, bubblegum and I could swear I also smell sweet barbecue or sweet barbecue sauce. Taste is sweet malt, candied fruit, bananas, bubblegum, light spice, wheat, soft spice, yeast, caramel, and light lemon. Body is medium with a full, bubbly carbonation. Sticky in spots as well. Finishes with more sweet malt, caramel, bubblegum, light spice, banana, cake and wheat.

12 oz bottle from the Beer Camp mixer.  Pours a deep hazy orange with a 1 finger white creamy head - which sticks around.  Aromas of banana, citrus, bubblegum, spice and wheat.  Medium to full body - very smooth and creamy throughout.  Lots of light fruit notes linger with the sweet malts across the tongue.  A touch of spice and bitterness follows.  Sweet creamy finish with more fruit tones and some bitterness.  Very nice and full bodied.

This starts with an aroma of sweet wheat.  It pours a nearly opaque, cloudy orange, with a full white head.  A slightly sweet beer, with a full wheat flavor.  Clean finish, with a touch of citrus.  This is a nice beer to have on a hot spring day.

Cloudy yellow out of the glass. Obnoxious foam just like most of these other "beer camp" styles. Dense white foam head. Buttery banana and clove aroma. Wait for the foam before you can taste it. Oooh, it tastes good. Like a strong hefeweizen with a lot of punch. Damn this is a refreshing beer. Just right for summer nights in Texas. Strong banana flavor, followed by a balancing hop bitterness. The banana flavor is very strong.

12 oz. bottle from Plaza Liquors - Pours a cloudy golden color with a one and a 1/3 finger thick white head.  Very light lacing.  Aroma is esters and spice.  Flavor is much of the same with the addition of some toasted malt.  Medium body.  Quite nice.

Poured into a weizen glass.  Color is a cloudy orange/yellow with a thick cream colored head.  Aroma is strong of wheat, banana, and clove.  Flavor is similar to a hefeweizen, just stronger in every way with the banana and clove flavors in the foregorund.  Im not real familiar with the Weizenbock style, but that seems to be correct.  Palate is smooth and light/medium bodied with a crisp finish.  Overall, a very nice beer that has me looking forward to trying some other Weizenbocks.

(bottle - 2011 edition)   Im not usually a fan of this style, but I was impressed.  Bright golden color cloudy, unfiltered.  Sweet malts, traditional Weiss, banana and lemon flavors.  Very refreshing with a nice finish.

Cloudy dark amber, almost brown, with a modest two-finger head and ok lace. Bananas, brown bread and spice on the nose. Flavors match, with some citrus and yeast in addition. Light to medium body, lots of carbonation and a creamy mouthfeel. Not a big wheat fan, but this was pretty good.

12oz bottle from beer camp mix pack.  pours a cloudy dark orange with a small, stable, white head.  hefe-like aroma with banana, clove.  palate is medium.  flavors are mostly banana and spice.  lacks any dark notes i enjoy from the style, although it is significantly maltier than a german hefe.

Very nice weizenbock from Sierra Nevada.  Looks solid, hazy brown-gold with a fluffy head that leaves ample lacing.  Smells like cloves and honey with a tiny bit of yeasty funk on the tip.  The taste is semisweet, with the normal culprits in bananas and clove, yet with a gooey honey thickness that fattens up the back end before it drifts into a mild dry finish.  Surprisingly modest hopping (this is SN, after all,) makes this bottle drift towards sweet as it warms, but thats only if you can manage to let it sit.  Tasty.

draft @ redlight redlight.  Big banana and clove aromas with some honey as well.  Pours a cloudy gold with a dense white head.  Sweet citrus upfront with banana and spicy clove with cinnamon notes, chewy mouthfeel.  I like a little more of the spice notes but this weizen bock is pretty good!
Beer Camp edition.  Pours a hazy lemonade iced tea color. Aroma is clove spice. Taste is hefeweizen with more cloves than bananas. Nice carbonation to it. Quite enjoyable.

Bottle. Pours a thick hazy orange color with a frothy white head. Nice, lemon aroma with thick malt. A hint of bubblegum as well. Amazing aroma. Light, fruity taste. Bubblegum with a hint of lemon. Some minor spice mixed in. But an incredible blend and flavor. Amazing job by Sierra Nevada.

12oz. Pours a murky dark toffee color with a towering dense and creamy light tan head. Really a big rocky mass of mousse on top of the beer--gorgeous. Sierra isnt messing around with these Beer Camp beers, theyre all very tasty at the least. Nice fragrant toffee nose, sweet butterscotch with light floral overtones. Very pleasant if youre in the mood for something candy-ish. Creamy medium body with light carb. Caramel, toffee, butterscotch, hay on the mid-palate. Just the lightest hint of funky grain, but its subtle and buried. Sweet tangy finish. Very nice beer.

Poured into my Sierra Nevada etched hops glass. Colour is a nice straw colour. Nice and cloudy. Aroma is of banana and clove like a good hefe yeast would be. Flavour is nice, sort of bitter, but very smooth wheat malt as well. Full bodied and finishes dry. Overall a good hefe.

12oz bottle.  Murky orange-tan with a steady off-white head.  Fresh banana clove aroma.  Doughy and rich, some pungent Bock tones, mild fruity flavors.  Mostly the yeast shines, as it should for the style.  Creamy and rich, yet very easy on the palate.  Maybe a hint more hops than a typical German example, which just adds to the depth.  Excellent, World Class Weizen Bock.
pours hazy orange with a nice white head and some lacing. aroma is oranges and yeast.  taste is yeast, coriander, oranges.  finish is lite.

Bottle from BevMo: Poured gloomy and heavily hazed glowing yellow and was topped by a delicate layer of froth. As for the aroma, my nose was able to detect German influenced yeast esters that have some scents of rotting banana, clove, and bazooka Joe bubblegum. The flavor is practically the same as the aroma except with a more apparent taste of spices that I am unable to identify other than perhaps clove? This reminds me almost exactly of their Kellerweis hefeweizen.

A - Pours a cloudy golden-orange color with a finger of white frothy head on top. The head fades down slowly to a thin layer leaving behind some nice lacing.

S - Aroma is full of wheat and fruit smells with some strong banana notes. There is also spices (clove and pepper) and some yeast mixed in.

T - Starts out with light lemon flavor and some wheat. There is a touch of banana in the background. Through the middle, more banana as well as some yeast and spices come in. Light pepper and clove. The finish is a mix of wheat, banana, lemon, pepper and some yeast that lingers.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth and super crisp. Never feels watery. The finish has some spices that tingle the tongue as the beer finishes and lingers.

D - Very drinkable. Flavors are really well balanced and complex enough. The banana and spices really work well together here. The spices in the finish are also really nice.

12oz bottle from BOBC Sampler.  Pours a cloudy, orange color with a white head.  Aroma is bready, yeasty, banana, and clove.  Medium body on the palate with soft carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, wheaty, yeasty, bready, with a smooth, clean finish.  Seems like a smoother version of a good wheat beer.  Tasty.

Nose of light bubblegum, wheat, lemon. Pours orange yellow, hazy, unfiltered, thin head. The flavor has notes of wheat, bubblegum, a hint of alcohol, a hint of banana. Not overly complex or interesting. Smooth creamy body.

Bottle. Fluffy and bubbly pure white head on a very, very murky darker orange-yellow. Banana and bubblegum in the aroma with a faint light fruit sweetness.  Actually, quite yeasty and doughy with some sourness.  Grassy, banana, and a slightly sweet-sour finish.  Medium body with tiny bubbly carbonation.  Solid.

bottle thanks to swalden28.  poured hazy honey yellow with a white head.  aroma was banana, clove, bubble gum, and citrus.  flavor was banana, bazooka joe bubble gum, slight peach, and some alcohol.  body was light with fizzy carbonation.

Thanks turd for sharing. Pours a bright cloudy amber yellow with three fingers of creamy sandstone head. Nice nose with sweet banana bread and clove and mild notes of spicy alcohol and a hint of tart wheat. Flavor is nice, not as all over the place yeasty as some of these can be. Weizen character is kept in check with the isoamyl acetate never getting out of control. Nice bready character. Full bodied with a medium carbonation. I enjoy!

12 oz bottle into dimpled mug. 2011 bottle from the Beer Camp variety pack. This bottle reads 6.8% ABV. Pours an extremely hazy orangeish-yellow (looks like freshly pureed oranges) with a nice-sized white head that lingers. Aroma is clove and banana (damn, I love the smell of a quality Weizen!). Taste is sweet, lightly tart and meaty with faint bitterness in the finish. Carbonation is medium-high, body is medium to full. Nice one.

12oz bottle as Sierra Nevada Beer Camp Weizenbock. Poured an orange color with a white, foamy head (long lasting). Flavor is dominated by banana yeast, notes of neutral malts. Flavor is touch of yeast, bread, banana. Not bad.

12 oz. bottle- Pours hazy cloudy orange with a nice pillowy white head and decent lacework, aroma is strong, it kind of smells like wort, beer that hasnt been fermented yet, I also detect banana and clove. The taste is strong in the banana esters and somewhat spicy from the clove, the yeast is very prominent as well, really smooth and creamy. The body is full, carbonation is medium high, finish clings on the roof of my mouth. nice beer, I know it is a different style, but their kellerweis is a little better.

Tallahassee, Fl - New Leaf Market - 12 oz bottle. Dark amber and orange pour with a sticky khaki colored head that leaves a nice coat of lacing. Yeasty, sweet aroma with some molasses notes and some baked bread goodness. Flavor is on the sweet side but not cloying. Pick up some caramel notes, cloves, molasses and some fresh baked bread. Mouthfeel is thick and chewy. Very decent.

(bottle)  Pours a muddy dark gold/yellow with a medium white head that retains and leaves moderate lacing.  Aroma is full of bubblegum, banana, wheat, and clove.  This really turns into a bubblegum bomb with further warming, and that certainly isnt a bad thing.  All the standard aromas are here, and for me thats all that needs to be here, as I really enjoy all of these aromatic components.  From time to time, however, there is an off scent I detect, and it appears to be methane, so I must deduct a point from the aroma.  Flavor has a stronger caramel undertone paired with ripe banana, and yields a bananas foster flavor, which again is standard and very good.  The wheat and bubblegum flavors sweep in on the finish and the wheat (with some clove perhaps) does a good job of cleaning up the sweetness.  Alcohol is not present.  Mouthfeel is medium, somewhat chalky on the finish, and the carbonation is very lively.  Overall this is a pretty good weizenbock, and I will admit that my rating is undoubtedly inflated due to my affinity for the style itself.

From the Beer Camp Series- intially poured a slightly hazy deep yellow, but with the added (and there is a TON of it) settled yeast it looked almost like a Sahti- very milky. The added sediment gave the palate lots of weight. Delicious and very, very drinkable.

Bottle.  Pours a glowing cloudy orange with a small egg shell white head and plenty of lace. Nose of banana, sharp tangerine, soap, lot of phenols but there is an underlying sharp citrus.  Bitterness is a little heavy in the flavor.  Not overly sweet, but a little rough around the edges.

12 oz bottle:  Aroma is wonderful big on banana and clove, yeast, and fruity.  Appearance is a very cloudy orangish with a thick white head.  Taste is banana, clove, yeast, a bit of hops, and maybe some malts in the backing.  Palate is medium carbonation, mouth coating,  finish has a lingering yeast and banana notes.  Overall, really solid Wiezen Bock.  Cheers!

Such a solid and magnificent brew.  Smells fruity and juicyfruit.  Tastes the same.  Goes down quite spelendidly.  Color is a burnt orange haze with dark yellow backbone.  Taste is completely fruity, with banana, tangerine, and citrus overtones.  Love this brew as it goes down with a force but can be enjoyed in numerations.  Solid.  Again, another solid brew from this variety pack!!!

NIce, spicy, fruity, tripel aroma.  Potato-masher west coast bottle, decent label.  Cloudy, apricot colored beer.  Nicely carbonated, edgy alcohol, spice-bitter, a savory quality to it.  Frothy, well-carbonated with a statisfying and sturdy mouthfeel.  A candied quality in the high palate on the finish.  Very good, high quality and true to style. New Leaf Market.
Pours hazy dark gold into a weizen glass. Bright white micro head recedes leaving spot lacing. Banana and clove aromas. Smooth with sweet clove and caramel upfront and a bitter, lasting pit finish.

Bottle, as Beer Camp Weizenbock.  Dark, murky orange color with a fading head.  Strong aroma of ripe bananas.  Tons of wheat and bread flavor.  Monsterously thick body.  Almost feels like Im biting into an overripe banana.

Strong banana and spice aromas float off the opaque yellow-orange body of this beer with a fluffy white head.  Definitely a weizenbock with a creamy body and lots more of that banana along with cloves and other spicy notes.  Light butterscotch and floral hops on the follow through.  Seems to follow the Kellerweis recipe but with even more of everything that makes that beer delicious.   I think this is what a really fresh German weizenbock would taste like!

Bottle: Pours a caramelly orange color with a nice white head. The nose is very estery with a nice banana and clove combo from the hefe yeast. Mild fruit; apple and more banana in the flavor with a clean balanced mouthfeel. The bock sweetness gives this a nice clean crusty flavor that pairs with the ample esters. Very nice balance and tasty, what a weizenbock should be!
Bottle, #37 of  beer camp series,  cloudy orange with nice tight white foam, aroma is Bubblegum, bananas, flavor of malty banana shake, somewhat astringent finish

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2011 Bottle from Sams in Durham.  Pours bright hazy orange with a fizzy, gauzy white head and decent lacing.  Nose is big banana and clove, as well as grain, wheat, and a funky yeast.  More hops than typical in this style of beer, and they show up fruity and citrusy on the taste as well.  Hints of toasted coconut. I am a sucker for this style, and this take on it makes me love it even more.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a completely hazed golden tan with a white head.  Aroma is quite estery, cloves, bubble gum wheat, some floral notes.  Strong biscuity wheat flavor with bubble gum and clove, some orange, and some florals.  Red apple hints.  Id call this a really good weizenbock.

12 oz. bottle from the Best of Beer Camp Mixed pack series.  Pours a glowing orangish red with a fairly decent white head on top.  Aroma of clove and banana.  Maybe a bit of bubble gum.  Flavor is fruity, spicy, bread and yeast notes.  Bubble gum notes, but lots of citrus which I like in my Weizen bocks.  This beer is medium-bodied,  active carbonation.  Pretty nice weizenbock.  Lots of estery fruits, easy to drink.  I like this.  This is a pretty great weizenbock.

The aroma is spicy, clove, bubblegum.  The appearance is very hazy orange brown, light in color for this style, thick white head.  The flavor is spicy first, then fruity, bubblegum.   Medium/thick in body.  The finish is sweet, peppery.  Not bad at all, but not a classic.  Certainly a serviceable weizenbock.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours hazy orange gold with a slight creamy beige head. Nice spicey aroma with fruit. Flavor is clvoe, fruit and just a bit of banana in the finish. Spicey finish.Earlier Rating: 1/23/2010 Total Score: 3.5Draft at the brewpub. Very hazy, slightly orange gold with a creamy off-white smear. Aromas of citrus, banana and wheat/malt. Medium plus body with creamy carbonation. Flavor is some banana and spice over wheat/malt. Almost some wood. Lots of un-sweet fruit. Taste lingers.

Bottle from Star Grocery, Berkeley, Pours cloudy orange gold with a decent but disappearting beige head and a fruity aroma. There is a hearty wheat flavor with a lot of carbonation and a slightly sour finish.

12 oz bottle out of  "Best of Beer Camp" variety 12 pk. Pours a very cloudy orange with creamy off-white head. Aroma of strong wheat malt, aggressive banana and clove, very bready and yeasty. Flavor is much the same with added spicy kick. Mouth feel is medium-heavy body with medium-high carbonation. Overall, very, tasty solid brew!

Bottle.  Pours a deep apricot orange, hazy and rather opaque with a medium to large creamy white head.  Banana and wheat on the nose, soft toast.  Creamy and smooth, nice mouthfeel with a good amount of creamy wheat and light banana yeast.  Simple and clean.  Soft wheat finish, tingly on the gums.  Nice and easy drinking.

Bottle:   Dirty straw, very cloudy, moderate white frothy head, nice lacing.   Good amount of banana, bubblegum, and clove on the nose.   Pale breadiness as well.   Yeah, well, wheaty too.   Has a fruity type bananaesque start.   Soft clove, bubblegum, and wheat malt, pale breadiness brings up the backside.   Pretty big, and flavorful.   Not as mealy as many American examples, so I am thankful for that.   Seems more fruity than most.   Pretty tasty.
bubblegum orange aroma, hazy yellow. little boozy with some wheat vodka, more lemon and bubblegum

Bottle.  Dark yellow banana (and very hazy) pour, a little lasting frothy carbonation and a decent strong banana nose.  Flavor is creamy banana, yeasty and bready and finished slightly effervescent.  Not bad, would make for a decent regular offering.

2011 bottle (beer camp series #37).  Cloudy amber pour with soapy white head that fades to a collar. Aroma is fruity yeast and spice. Taste is sweet yeast bread and bubblegum with a hoppy finish. Palate is thin to medium feel with a slick chaulky finish. Very good brew, enjoyed quite a bit. Should consider a regular offering!

355mL from Beer Camp Sampler Pack. The pour is a dirty, deeper golden with lots of haze. Small, rocky, yellow, suddy head ignites and settles down quickly. No lace. Big banana pudding, lemon, heavy bubblegum in the nose with mild sulfur. Taste is sweet banana pudding, sugar, whipped cream, slight bitterness, malty, oatmeal, heavy dessert, red apple slices. Doesnt feel particularly weizenBOCKy but more just like a nice Bavarian hefeweizen. Good palate. On style albeit maybe even a little more banana forward than some German classics. Heavy sugar and aspartame detract from the palate.
Tons of bananas in the aroma. The flavor starts of fruity, but a tinge of hops and alcohol comes on as well (perhaps from the other beers this evening).  Very much like a strong Schneiderweisse.
fresh growler from 2008 keg. Cloudy pale.  Slight murk; yet very light looking. Banana bubble gum all day. Bubbly.  Very easy yet complex & still velvety w age.

8 ounce sample on tap at the brewpub.  They had it listed as 7.8%, which is greater than the listing here.  Aroma has lots of bubblegum notes present.  Some banana esters are also in the background.  Pretty fruity and estery.  Perhaps some sourness is there as well.  Murky, muddy, opaque yellow-orange body with a creamy white head.  Holy bubblegum!  Lots of bubblegum estery flavors to start.  Creamy, sweet, and smooth in the middle , with a nice finish. The most bubblegummy beer I have ever experienced.
great yeast flavor.  bold banana and clove dominate to the point that not much else is going.  a  bit too sweet and the flavor really comes on full force
Pours hazy gold with a big white head.  Aroma is banana and clove.  Flavor is nice bready malted wheat with some nice banana, clove and bubble gum notes.  Pretty good.

Draught at Bishops Arms Järntorget, Göteborg, on September 26, 2009.Apparently it has been forgotten in the back, so been in the storage room a while, over a year or so.Hazy golden color, fluffy white head. Smooth, sweet, candy, banana scent. Sweet, banana taste, a bit fruity. Moussy mouthfeel, low bitterness.

Tap at ACBF. Happens to be entered as rating 1200, but working intermittently from a haphazard backlog and current ratings...but still a fine selection I feel. W00t! Ok. Aroma puts the wheat at the forefront, with lots of juicy citrus right behind, and clove and banana that are pleasant yet under control. Flavor very fruity and very wheaty, sweet in a refreshing way, very bright. Highly refreshing. Quite nice stuff.
Aroma of citrus fruit.  Flavor also of citrus fruit.  Nice beer, would have again.

On draft at ACBF09.  Pours a cloudy yellow with a small white head.  Aroma of wheat, melon, clove.  Flavor is more fruity with tropical fruits, lemon, and citrus.  Light and refreshing.  A nice surprise!
7/4/8/4/15 (3.8/5)

Pours hazy golden with a well maintained off-white foamy head. Aroma of banana, honey, and bread dough. Taste is citric, banana, honey, bread dough and orange. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with lively carbonation.

On tap at The Rake.  Cloudy gold, little head.  Banana estery aroma.  This is rubbish.  Just all over the place.  The alcohol doesnt go with the banana, the hops dont go with anything and the clove is pretty poor.  I struggled to finish a half.  Over carbonated too.  You do get used to it, but its not a good beer and I passed up Dark Star Impy Stout on cask for this.??

Hazed overripe pineapple color, lacey bright white suds atop.  Wheaty/yeasty nose with banana, clove, cardomom.  Flavors on a thin somewhat watery palate, showing some of the aforementioned spices, banana sweetness, wheaty rustic weizenbock flavors with a little booziness in the finish. I guess its good but more alcohol and a thicker, meatier body would have elevated it to the next level.

ON tap at SDBC.  Color was a dark, cloudyish gold with an off whitish head.  Aroma of sweet banana, wheat and vanilla.  Flavor was good, with a nice blend of sweetness and banana.  Thirst quenching and drinkable.  Good, not great for the style.

Had on tap at Winking Lizard.  Was a nice change from Stones Levitation.  Really tasty with notable banana flavor and a little bubblegum.  Real smooth palate and a nice refreshing finish.  All in all, a damn tasty beer.
Draught at CNY Brewfest. Pours cloudy gold with slight brownish hue.  Aroma is lemony with yeast breadiness. Some banana in there. Flavor is similar. Not as complex as other weizenbocks.

Draught at Bishops Arms Vasagaatn, Stockholm. Pours out in a cloudy dark dark yellow appearance with a rich and firm white foam. Big and sweet aroma of yeast, banana and cloves with notes of apricots, cinnamon and leaves. Medium-bodied with sweet and yeasty notes of banana, cloves, vanilla, dough and apricots. Long yeasty finish of cloves, banana and dough. Low bitterness.

(Sample Date: 11/28/2008   Source:Other)   Grainy wheat aroma with some spicy banana clove character. Cloudy golden with an orange tinge. Flavor leans towards the malts with an orange floral hop flavor. Finish is fairly dry with spicy yeast bitterness. Light body and mouthfeel. Well carbonated. Tasty.

(Draught at Bishops Arms, Vasagatan, Stockholm, 24 Jan 2009) Cloudy yellow colour with big, frothy, off-white head. Fruity, malty nose with orange, pineapple, tropical fruit and hints of banana. Fruity, wheaty taste with notes of pineapple, tropical fruit, banana and lemon. Well structured: above medium body and smooth mouthfeel. Fairly sweet, but balanced. Slightly spicy finish. Nice and tasty. In short: wheaty pineapple with banana and spices.

Draught at Bishops Arms Vasagatan, Stockholm.  Cloudy golden, brief head. Strong perfumy aroma of banana esters and bubblegum. Sweet and honeyish, above medium bodied with clean rounded, solid mouthfeel. Moderately warming finish without bitterness. While stylistically a perfect rendition of a German Weizenbock it has a certain American feel to it favouring more direct and upfront appeal above depth.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2011 6/2/2011 ahhh how the time goes by and the tasters develop. bottle now from a mixed 12 pack from the beer camp series. very nice full coating mouth feel and  a ton of weizen flavors. nice and juicy with a hefty feel from the strength. the dough and banana flavors complement the beer itself and it is very drinkable.

1/22/09 tap poured a light golden color with a white head and streaming carbonation. aroma has some wheat, sweet yeast, and dough. mouth feel is light and the flavor has a nice banana yeast. typical hops for sierra but toned down with grass and sweetness. an interesting beer for sierra that comes off rather well.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2011 Bottle courtesy of Butters as Beer Camp Weizenbock on 06/22/2011. Cloudy orange body with a small creamy white head. Sweet clove aroma with light banana notes. Sweet clove flavor, some spice and a dry banana background. Medium body with moderate carbonation. 7/2/6/3/14 - 3.2

On tap at Capital Ale House - Downtown on 11/25/2008. Hazy orange body with a large foamy off-white head. Sweet banana, clove and light bready aroma. Sweet banana, lemon, citrus, clove and bready flavor. Medium body with moderately high carbonation. 7/2/7/4/15 - 3.5
Pours a hazy gold, fizzy white head.  This is a banana fest.  Sweet malt, banana, notes of bread, clove, and some citrus.  It’s not my thing, good for the summer I would think.

On tap at Pizza Port Carlsbad.  Pours with a huge off-white head and a hazy yellow body, tons of lacing. Aroma of banana, vanilla and caramel toffee. Taste is alcohol, banana and some clove, with a touch of citrus. Lively carbonation.

On-tap at PP C’Bad. Pours cloudy yellow/orange with a moderate white head, good lace. Smells light and malty sweet, citrusy, nice. Tastes malty and sweet, crisp and citrusy. A little banana and some bubblegum in there. Tasty. Medium body, crisp carbonation.
Tap at Downtown Johnny Brown’s.  Poured a slightly hazed yellow with a small off white head.  Nose was fruity and malty.....same with the flavor, not overly impressed.
Tap at Stone. Poured a cloudy yellow with a nice white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Sweet flavor as well, slight citrus and banana flavor to it, very good.
